_header: I am old when age doth appeal
_description: The trials of old men in love — one 8-line stanza

BodTan407.First Lines:
I am olde whan age doth apeleHauyng a yong thyng þat lytell
                    settyth me by…
BodTan407.Last Lines:
…Younght is a traytour her experiens at eyeoftyn tymes and
                    many þe blynde etyth many aflye
BodTan407.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 164.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 69.
